actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 599.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 599 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3500 West 6th Street, Suite 103 in Los Angeles, California, as the "Dosan Ahn Chang Ho Post Office"."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Donalds objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3728.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3728 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 25 Dorchester Avenue, Room 1, in Boston, Massachusetts, as the "Caroline Chang Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3947.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3947 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 859 North State Road 21 in Melrose, Florida, as the "Pamela Jane Rock Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3865.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3865 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 101 South 8th Street in Lebanon, Pennsylvania, as the "Lieutenant William D. Lebo Post Office Building"."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Donalds objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2754.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2754 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 2395 East Del Mar Boulevard in Laredo, Texas, as the "Lance Corporal David Lee Espinoza, Lance Corporal Juan Rodrigo Rodriguez & Sergeant Roberto Arizola Jr. Post Office Building"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3427.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3427 — "To extend the authority to provide employees of the United States Secret Service with overtime pay beyond other statutory limitations, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5528.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Donalds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5528 — "To evaluate the impact of the lowest price technically acceptable source selection process on national security, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 29.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a communication from William P. McFarland, Sergeant at Arms. Pursuant to Rule VIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives, Mr. McFarland notified the House that the Office of the Sergeant at Arms for the House of Representatives had been served with a grand jury subpoena for documents issued by the U.S. Department of Justice and that after consulting with the Office of General Counsel, he had determined that compliance with the subpoena is consistent with the rights and privileges of the House.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on January 25, 2024, at 3:52 p.m.: That the Senate agreed to S. Con. Res. 26; that the Senate passed S. 2853 and S. 3646. Appointments: Health Information Technology Advisory Committee, Board of Trustees of the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development, and Washington's Farewell Address.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 29.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Cliff Bentz to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
